intro: Agapetes pottingeri, commonly known as the silverleaf agapete, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters and blooming in late summer. Agapetes pottingeri is adapted to cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests.
